## 4. No borrowing (Bayesian) method
### 4.1 Compatible situation - Two Parameters

```{r}
# Set Nimble model
# No borrowing Bayesian model for two parameters
library(nimble)

code_nobo <- nimbleCode({
  # Prior distribution
  beta0_h ~ dnorm(0, sd=1000)
  beta1_h ~ dnorm(0, sd=1000)
  
  beta0_c ~ dnorm(0, sd=1000)  # Independent prior for beta0_c
  beta1_c ~ dnorm(0, sd=1000)  # Independent prior for beta1_c
  
  sigma1 ~ dunif(0, 1000)
  sigma2 ~ dunif(0, 1000)
  
  # Historical data likelihood
  for (i in 1:n){
    y_h[i] ~ dnorm(beta0_h + beta1_h * x[i], sd = sigma1)
  }
  
  # Current data likelihood
  for (i in 1:n){
    y_c[i] ~ dnorm(beta0_c + beta1_c * x[i], sd=sigma2)
  }
})
```

```{r}
set.seed(123)
# True values of parameters
beta0_h <- 1  
beta1_h <- 1  
beta0_c <- 1  # True value for beta0_c
beta1_c <- 1  # True value for beta1_c
n <- 200 
n_sim <- 100  

# Record the results of simulation
results_nobo_bayes_com <- data.frame(
  beta0c_Estimate = numeric(n_sim), 
  beta0c_Lower_CI = numeric(n_sim), 
  beta0c_Upper_CI = numeric(n_sim),
  beta1c_Estimate = numeric(n_sim), 
  beta1c_Lower_CI = numeric(n_sim), 
  beta1c_Upper_CI = numeric(n_sim)
)

# Do 100 replicates of simulation
for (i in 1:n_sim) {
  # Generate data
  x <- runif(n,-1,1)
  e1 <- rnorm(n, mean=0, sd=0.5)  # error term
  e2 <- rnorm(n, mean=0, sd=0.5)
  y_h <- beta0_h + beta1_h * x + e1  
  y_c <- beta0_c + beta1_c * x + e2
  
  # Input data
  data_nimble <- list(
    y_h = y_h,
    y_c = y_c
  )
  constants_nimble <- list(
    n = length(x),
    x = x
  )
  # Set initial values
  inits_nimble <- list(beta0_h=0.5, beta1_h=0.5, beta0_c=0.5, beta1_c=0.5, sigma1=1, sigma2=1)
  
  # Build NIMBLE model
  nimble_model <- nimbleModel(
    code = code_nobo,
    data = data_nimble,
    constants = constants_nimble,
    inits = inits_nimble
  )
  
  # Compile model
  compiled_model <- compileNimble(nimble_model)
  
  # MCMC sampling
  mcmc_conf <- configureMCMC(nimble_model)
  mcmc_conf$addMonitors(c("beta0_h", "beta1_h", "beta0_c", "beta1_c", "sigma1", "sigma2"))  # Monitor parameters
  compiled_mcmc <- buildMCMC(mcmc_conf)
  compiled_mcmc <- compileNimble(compiled_mcmc, project = nimble_model)
  
  # Run MCMC
  samples <- runMCMC(compiled_mcmc, niter = 1000, nburnin = 500)
  
  # Extract estimates and CI
  samples_df <- as.data.frame(samples)
  
  # Beta0_c estimates
  beta0c_hat <- mean(samples_df$beta0_c)
  beta0c_lower_CI <- quantile(samples_df$beta0_c, 0.025)
  beta0c_upper_CI <- quantile(samples_df$beta0_c, 0.975)
  
  # Beta1_c estimates
  beta1c_hat <- mean(samples_df$beta1_c)
  beta1c_lower_CI <- quantile(samples_df$beta1_c, 0.025)
  beta1c_upper_CI <- quantile(samples_df$beta1_c, 0.975)
  
  # Save the results
  results_nobo_bayes_com[i, ] <- c(beta0c_hat, beta0c_lower_CI, beta0c_upper_CI, 
                                  beta1c_hat, beta1c_lower_CI, beta1c_upper_CI)
  
  # Print progress
  cat("Completed", i, "simulations\n")
}
```

```{r}
# Calculate statistics for each simulation, then take average
# Beta0_c statistics
beta0c_bias <- results_nobo_bayes_com$beta0c_Estimate - beta0_c
beta0c_mean_bias <- mean(beta0c_bias)
beta0c_var <- var(results_nobo_bayes_com$beta0c_Estimate)
beta0c_mse <- mean((results_nobo_bayes_com$beta0c_Estimate - beta0_c)^2)
beta0c_rmse <- sqrt(beta0c_mse)
beta0c_coverage <- mean(results_nobo_bayes_com$beta0c_Lower_CI <= beta0_c & 
                        results_nobo_bayes_com$beta0c_Upper_CI >= beta0_c)
beta0c_relative_bias <- beta0c_mean_bias / beta0_c  # relative bias
beta0c_mean_CI_width <- mean(results_nobo_bayes_com$beta0c_Upper_CI - results_nobo_bayes_com$beta0c_Lower_CI)  # CI width


# Beta1_c statistics
beta1c_bias <- results_nobo_bayes_com$beta1c_Estimate - beta1_c
beta1c_mean_bias <- mean(beta1c_bias)
beta1c_var <- var(results_nobo_bayes_com$beta1c_Estimate)
beta1c_mse <- mean((results_nobo_bayes_com$beta1c_Estimate - beta1_c)^2)
beta1c_rmse <- sqrt(beta1c_mse)
beta1c_coverage <- mean(results_nobo_bayes_com$beta1c_Lower_CI <= beta1_c & 
                        results_nobo_bayes_com$beta1c_Upper_CI >= beta1_c)
beta1c_relative_bias <- beta1c_mean_bias / beta1_c  # relative bias  
beta1c_mean_CI_width <- mean(results_nobo_bayes_com$beta1c_Upper_CI - results_nobo_bayes_com$beta1c_Lower_CI)  # CI width


# Output for beta0_c
cat("--- Beta0_c Statistics (Compatible Scenario) ---\n")
cat("Mean Bias:", beta0c_mean_bias, "\n")
cat("Variance:", beta0c_var, "\n")
cat("MSE:", beta0c_mse, "\n")
cat("RMSE:", beta0c_rmse, "\n")
cat("95% Coverage Probability:", beta0c_coverage, "\n\n")
cat("Relative Bias:", beta0c_relative_bias, "\n")
cat("Mean CI Width:", beta0c_mean_CI_width, "\n")

# Output for beta1_c
cat("--- Beta1_c Statistics (Compatible Scenario) ---\n")
cat("Mean Bias:", beta1c_mean_bias, "\n")
cat("Variance:", beta1c_var, "\n")
cat("MSE:", beta1c_mse, "\n")
cat("RMSE:", beta1c_rmse, "\n")
cat("95% Coverage Probability:", beta1c_coverage, "\n")
cat("Relative Bias:", beta1c_relative_bias, "\n")
cat("Mean CI Width:", beta1c_mean_CI_width, "\n")
```

### 4.2 Incompatible situation - Two Parameters

```{r}
set.seed(123)
# True values of parameters
beta0_h <- 5 
beta1_h <- 5
beta0_c <- 1    # True value for beta0_c
beta1_c <- 1    # True value for beta1_c
n <- 200 
n_sim <- 100  

# Record the results of simulation
results_nobo_bayes_incom <- data.frame(
  beta0c_Estimate = numeric(n_sim), 
  beta0c_Lower_CI = numeric(n_sim), 
  beta0c_Upper_CI = numeric(n_sim),
  beta1c_Estimate = numeric(n_sim), 
  beta1c_Lower_CI = numeric(n_sim), 
  beta1c_Upper_CI = numeric(n_sim)
)

# Initialize vectors to store each MCMC variance
beta0c_variances <- numeric(n_sim)
beta1c_variances <- numeric(n_sim)

# Do 100 replicates of simulation
for (i in 1:n_sim) {
  # Generate data
  x <- runif(n,-1,1)
  e1 <- rnorm(n, mean=0, sd=0.5)  # error term
  e2 <- rnorm(n, mean=0, sd=0.5)
  y_h <- beta0_h + beta1_h * x + e1  # Historical data with beta1_h = 1.5
  y_c <- beta0_c + beta1_c * x + e2   # Current data with beta1_c = 1
  
  # Input data
  data_nimble <- list(
    y_h = y_h,
    y_c = y_c
  )
  constants_nimble <- list(
    n = length(x),
    x = x
  )
  # Set initial values
  inits_nimble <- list(beta0_h=0.5, beta1_h=1.0, beta0_c=0.5, beta1_c=0.5, sigma1=1, sigma2=1)
  
  # Build NIMBLE model
  nimble_model <- nimbleModel(
    code = code_nobo,
    data = data_nimble,
    constants = constants_nimble,
    inits = inits_nimble
  )
  
  # Compile model
  compiled_model <- compileNimble(nimble_model)
  
  # MCMC sampling
  mcmc_conf <- configureMCMC(nimble_model)
  mcmc_conf$addMonitors(c("beta0_h", "beta1_h", "beta0_c", "beta1_c", "sigma1", "sigma2"))  # Monitor parameters
  compiled_mcmc <- buildMCMC(mcmc_conf)
  compiled_mcmc <- compileNimble(compiled_mcmc, project = nimble_model)
  
  # Run MCMC
  samples <- runMCMC(compiled_mcmc, niter = 1000, nburnin = 500)
  
  # Extract estimates and CI
  samples_df <- as.data.frame(samples)
  
  # Beta0_c estimates
  beta0c_hat <- mean(samples_df$beta0_c)
  beta0c_lower_CI <- quantile(samples_df$beta0_c, 0.025)
  beta0c_upper_CI <- quantile(samples_df$beta0_c, 0.975)
  
  # Beta1_c estimates
  beta1c_hat <- mean(samples_df$beta1_c)
  beta1c_lower_CI <- quantile(samples_df$beta1_c, 0.025)
  beta1c_upper_CI <- quantile(samples_df$beta1_c, 0.975)
  
  # Calculate variance for each MCMC run
  beta0c_mcmc_var <- var(samples_df$beta0_c)
  beta1c_mcmc_var <- var(samples_df$beta1_c)
  
  # Save the results
  results_nobo_bayes_incom[i, ] <- c(beta0c_hat, beta0c_lower_CI, beta0c_upper_CI, 
                                  beta1c_hat, beta1c_lower_CI, beta1c_upper_CI)
  # Save the variances separately
  beta0c_variances[i] <- beta0c_mcmc_var
  beta1c_variances[i] <- beta1c_mcmc_var
  
  # Print progress
  cat("Completed simulation", i, "of", n_sim, "\n")
}
```

```{r}
#use this!
# Method 2: Alternative approach using average of individual MCMC variances
# (Mean variance = average of variances within each MCMC run)

# Calculate bias for each simulation
beta0c_biases <- results_nobo_bayes_incom$beta0c_Estimate - beta0_c
beta1c_biases <- results_nobo_bayes_incom$beta1c_Estimate - beta1_c

# Calculate means
beta0c_mean_bias_alt <- mean(beta0c_biases)
beta1c_mean_bias_alt <- mean(beta1c_biases)

# Calculate average of individual MCMC variances
beta0c_mean_mcmc_var <- mean(beta0c_variances)
beta1c_mean_mcmc_var <- mean(beta1c_variances)

# Other statistics remain the same
beta0c_mse_alt <- mean((results_nobo_bayes_incom$beta0c_Estimate - beta0_c)^2)
beta0c_rmse_alt <- sqrt(beta0c_mse_alt)
beta0c_coverage_alt <- mean(results_nobo_bayes_incom$beta0c_Lower_CI <= beta0_c & 
                           results_nobo_bayes_incom$beta0c_Upper_CI >= beta0_c)
beta0c_relative_bias_alt <- beta0c_mean_bias_alt / beta0_c
beta0c_mean_CI_width_alt <- mean(results_nobo_bayes_incom$beta0c_Upper_CI - results_nobo_bayes_incom$beta0c_Lower_CI)

beta1c_mse_alt <- mean((results_nobo_bayes_incom$beta1c_Estimate - beta1_c)^2)
beta1c_rmse_alt <- sqrt(beta1c_mse_alt)
beta1c_coverage_alt <- mean(results_nobo_bayes_incom$beta1c_Lower_CI <= beta1_c & 
                           results_nobo_bayes_incom$beta1c_Upper_CI >= beta1_c)
beta1c_relative_bias_alt <- beta1c_mean_bias_alt / beta1_c
beta1c_mean_CI_width_alt <- mean(results_nobo_bayes_incom$beta1c_Upper_CI - results_nobo_bayes_incom$beta1c_Lower_CI)



# Output Method 2 results
cat("=== Method 2: Using Average of Individual MCMC Variances ===\n")

cat("95% Coverage Probability:", beta1c_coverage_alt, "\n\n")
cat("Relative Bias:", beta1c_relative_bias_alt, "\n")
cat("Mean CI Width:", beta1c_mean_CI_width_alt, "\n")
```
